posts.description:
“Track” Tuesday called for 6 x 1 miles, with 400m jog recovery between each 🏃🏻‍♀️ Feeling better and better about these speed workouts — hopefully it all pays off in Eugene 12 days from now! 😬😳
.
.
.
.

Why do I always happen to have speedwork to do on days when there are 25-35mph winds?! 🌬I should probably find a different place to run besides the river on days like today... 🤦🏻‍♀️ Not gonna lie, I was thiiiiiiis close to putting it off til tomorrow... but thank GOD it’s done! ✅👊🏼 ANDDD tomorrow’s Friday!!!! Happy almost-weekend, friends! 🙂
.
.
.
.

And that’s a wrap!!! First month of 2018 is in the books 🗓✅ I’ve been focusing a lot on posture over the past couple of months, and while I definitely have a long way to go, I’m FINALLY starting to see a difference! 5 easy miles today, my right hamstring has been irritating me a bit, so I’m trying not to push it! Lots of foam rolling tonight for all my study breaks 🤓📚 .
.
.
.

Had the roads to myself on my long run today, clearly the @bostonmarathon is tomorrow!! 😋 One of my last double-digit runs before the @eugenemarathon two weeks from today! But for nowwww I can’t wait to go out and cheer for all the runners tomorrow, you all are superstars!! 🌟💙💛
.
.
.
.

I DID ITTT!!!! Boston 2019 here I come!!!😭 Trust. The. PROCESS. I couldn’t have asked for more perfect running conditions today, or for a more amazing running group/coach (@heartbreakersrun / @coachdanbos) who constantly push me at practice to get me to where I am. On cloud 9 today, that’s for sure 😍☁️ Congrats to ALL the runners, way to get out there and grind 🙌🏼 💪🏼
.
.
.
.

“Be relentless.” -@ShalaneFlanagan just inspires me every. damn. day. Heart rate is still a little elevated since Chicago, so I took it easy today with a nice, relaxing 3.5 miler during lunch break 🙂 Now back to the books! 📚🤓👩🏻‍⚕️ .
.
.
.

Made it to my first @heartbreakrunco speed work practice tonight! Got in a few tempo miles followed by drills — SO much more fun with a group than by myself!! Can’t wait to see what @coachdanbos has in store for us next week 😎👊🏼
.
.
.
.

Late post buuut I’m too excited about how this workout went to NOT post anything... 3 x 2 miles @ 15-20 seconds faster than MGP, with 800m jog recovery between repeats, 10 miles total. I was pretty nervous going into it because it’s getting to be that point in the training cycle where my legs just feel like friggin cinder blocks 24/7, but today felt SO GOOOOD 🤗 Now time for some R&R before a 19-miler this weekend, aka legs up da wall and @teamtiux compression socks 😘❤️
.
.
.
.

Oyyyy it was just one of those days... 🤦🏻‍♀️Took it easy today focusing on keeping the HR low, and yet my left posterior tib was bothering me MORE during this “easy” 6-miler than it has the past couple of weeks.... 🤔I had been planning to do Yasso 800s tomorrow provided my leg wasn’t bothering me, so I’ll just have to play it by ear and adjust if necessary tomorrow! 😅 Over halfway to the weekend, LETS GOOO!! ☀️😴
.
.
.
.

Got to check off a bucket list item on the most beautiful shakeout run I could’ve asked for — finally got to run on Pre’s trail ❤️ Getting ready for the big dayyy, @eugenemarathon here I come!! 🏃🏻‍♀️ Good luck to everyone running tomorrow! Let’s do this 👊🏼🍀
.
.
.
.

That feeling when your tempo pace starts feeling easy... 😍🎉🍾 I really concentrated on finding my pace and staying there, and I’m SO happy with my splits (7:50, 7:49, 7:49, 7:39). This was actually yesterday’s workout, I’m a little late to the game 😋 Today’s just going to be an easy 3 miles to shake out the legs before my long run tomorrow!!
.
.
.
.

With finals coming up, fitting in all of my planned workouts has been tough, but no excuses!! Fit in 4 miles @7:50/mi pace between my morning practical and afternoon review sessions. MAKE TIME!!! 🏃🏻‍♀️💨
.
.
.
.

Ordered my new @believetrainingjournal just in time — I’m on the last week of my current one!! This journal has been an amazing way of reminding myself how far I’ve come. Today’s workout was 4 x 1.5mi @ 10 seconds faster than MGP — went our WAY too fast for the first 3 and was basically hanging on by a thread to maintain a 7:50 for the last one. Definitely not what I had in mind, but not every workout is going to be a perfect one — and that’s OKAY! Just gotta keep your progress in mind and your goals in sight 🙂
.
.
.
.

My failed attempt at making it to Heartbreakers track practice this AM ended with me having to do 5 miles around the north end this morning 😒 But at least I was in the holiday spirit with my tank! 🎄🎅🏻☃️
1 mile up
3 mile tempo
1 mile down
.
.
.
.

This morning’s wake up call was deffffinitely brutal after my speed work last night, but I got it done ✅ 6 easy miles in the bank before a full day of class, and then some friggin delicious Mediterranean herbed salmon for dinner to reward myself 🤤 Is it bed time yet...? ✏️📚😴
.
.
.
.

3.5 miles with 6x strides to wrap it up, followed by a killer 7-way hip strength workout vid by @coachdanbos!! 😎💪🏼 And nowww it’s finals crunch time... 🤦🏻‍♀️🤓📚
.
.
.
.

Not gonna lie, my new @heartbreakrunco socks made me feel like a rockstar on my run today 🌟 Which really was great timing because this workout was hard A.F. with that headwind along the Charles today 😒 4 x 1.5 miles today, 800 meter jog recovery between each, trying to keep the pace 10-20 seconds per mile faster than my MGP — success! ✅ (Averages per repeat: 7:50, 7:41, 7:48, 7:42) Almost FRIDAY!!!! .
.
.
.

Fantastic Heartbreakers practice, as per usuallll. 💔Legs were still feeling a little tired from Sunday’s long run, but thankfully this group makes it SO much easier to get some speed work in! 🙂
3ish mile tempo run
6 x 200m @ 5k
9 miles total for the night

And nowww time to start studying for finals! ...😒
.
.
.
.

Just a Bostonian in her natural habitat!! Trudged a mile through a foot of unshoveled snow to get my run in at the gym only to find that the gym was closed... 😑 So I resorted to an upper body workout instead, aka shoveling out my car in the living nightmare that is Charlestown parking 😉 better luck tomorrow?? 🍀🤞🏼
.
.
.
.

Another awesome Track Tuesday in the books this morning before class!
3 x 1600s (7:04, 6:57, 6:54)
w/600m recovery jog between each, followed by @coachdanbos 7-Way Hip workout 💪🏼🔥 I’ve really been focusing on glute activation the past couple of weeks since realizing that my butt can be a little lazy at times (...in more ways that one 😜) and the muscles don’t want to fire when they should be, but today I actually really noticed a difference!! Felt wicked strong throughout the workout, which was SO encouraging! 🙂
.
.
.

The smile says it all... NAILED my long run today, and then got to enjoy one of my favorite post run snacks — @pickybars!! This is also the most miles I’ve EVER done in a week (50 miles!!) @eugenemarathon here I comeeee 😄❤️🏃🏻‍♀️
.
.
.
.

You’re looking at two new Heartbreakers!! 💔 Sooo much fun at the @heartbreakrunco recruiting night last night, and incredibly excited for the journey ahead!! 🙂
.
.
.
.

Happy Medal Monday!! Almost exactly one month ago marks the day I qualified for Boston at the Chicago Marathon 💙💛3:35:00 on the nose 🙂 It unfortunately won’t be enough to get me a bib for 2019, BUT it inspired me to document my journey!! Just gotta shave a few minutes off my time, and I figured this would be the perfect way to hold myself accountable! .
.
.
.

TRACK TUESDAAAY!! 🏃🏻‍♀️💨 8x800s this morning before the rain started, tried to run 3:30 repeats butttt clearly I suck at consistency so my times were kind of all over the place... (3:34, 3:26, 3:30, 3:25, 3:27, 3:33, 3:28, 3:31) but practice makes progress! I’ll get there 🙂 7 miles total for the day, happy almost-hump-day, friends!!!
.
.
.
.

Long and Strong! 👊🏼 12 miles today, settling into a nice, comfortable pace. The wind made it a bit difficult, but I was pretty happy with maintaining my 8:30 mi/avg! Long run done for the weekend ✅ .
.
.
.

And after two beautiful days of 50+ degree weather, we’re back into the teens... 🙄 3.5 comfortable miles followed by some core work! .
.
.
.

Reasons 1 and 2 why I should look into getting yaktrax... this has NOT been my week for running 🙄 Butttt the good news is it’s my first two-digit run since my tendonitis flareup a few weeks ago!! Always look for the silver lining 😉
.
.
.
.

I went into this run without any pace goals in mind. I just wanted one final weekend run at a nice, comfortable pace before the Eugene Marathon next weekend. That “comfortable” pace ended up being a 7:52/mi average, and I couldn’t be happier!! 🙂 It’s amazing how this pace used to be my tempo run pace and today it felt SO nice and relaxed. Let’s just hope it feels that way on race day!!! ONE. WEEK. 😳🎉🏃🏻‍♀️
.
.
.
.

Didn’t think I’d be wearing this @heartbreakersrun singlet outside so early, buuuut when it’s 68° in February...💁🏻‍♀️ 5 relaxed miles, ending with 6x strides, and some core work!! Happy hump day, friends!! 🙂💕
.
.
.
.

I think it’s safe to say my tendonitis has subsided and my foot is finally feeling normal again!!! 🙌🏼 No pain for a week! Time to build that base mileage back up again — a mini 4 mile progression run this evening in my new Heartbreakers hat 🙃💔 (9:17, 8:58, 8:27, 8:02)
.
.
.
.

5 progression miles on this chilly Saturday! (9:11, 8:41, 8:25, 8:04, 7:37) 7 miles total for the day! Now time to defrost a bit ❄️⛄️
.
.
.
.

April 19th, and I’m still dressing like I was in February 😑 5 miles at MGP today, 7 miles total! It’s crazy how fast this training cycle has flown by 😳😣
.
.
.
.

7 mile tempo today, and I couldn’t be happier with how it went. 🤗🙃💃🏻
1 mi w/u
7 mi @ 7:48, 7:46, 7:45, 7:40, 7:47, 7:44, 7:44
1 mi c/d
Just the right amount of challenging! I had been aiming for a 7:50/mi average but I was a bit nervous about being able to maintain it, so understandably this was SUCH a nice surprise/confidence boost. 7 miles yesterday that I neglected to post about 🤦🏻‍♀️, 9 miles total for today, and now I am SO ready for my rest day tomorrow, mamma miaaaa. 😴
.
.
.
.

Trying my hardest not to get wiiiicked frustrated about not being able to run, so I’m focusing on strength work instead! In the meantime, enjoy the view of my gnarly thigh bruise... 🤦🏻‍♀️
.
.
.
.

GUYS. IT’S ALMOST FRIYAYYYY!!! 🎉🙃 Throwback to my first marathon — and to being able to run outside in shorts 😭 6 cold, windy miles today: 4 miles nice and relaxed, and mixed in 2 miles at a 7:45/mi to get that speed in there. You get faster by running faster!! 😉🙌🏼 .
.
.
.

Tempo Thursday in my new @on_running shoes!!! 😍😍😍 So much fun getting some speed work back into my base training after marathon training the past couple months 🙃 35 minute tempo at a 7:40/mi. It’s crazy how hard that pace felt just a few months ago!!
.
.
.
.

Love my neighborhood viewsss 😍😍 Thankfully even in all of the end-of-semester craziness, I was able to sneak in a 5 miler and some core work between my AM practical and PM written exam today 🙏🏻 I swear running keeps me sane in these stressful times hahah 😜
.
.
.
.

Leg dayyyy!!! I had wanted to do a nice 7 mile progression run today, but unfortunately AM and PM class got in the way... but NO EXCUSES! 👊🏼 I still managed to fit in some leg strength and a nice 3 miler during lunch! 🙂
.
.
.
.

Original plan ⇢ head to the gym and bang out 4 x 1.5 mi repeats on the treadmill
Plan B once I got to the gym to see that it was closed ⇢ 10 easy miles around Charlestown. The weather’s been making this training cycle pretttty tricky (I’m sure all my fellow New Englanders can relate!! 😝) so sometimes you just gotta be flexible!! Today’s focus ended up being just getting more miles in the bank and focusing a bit more on my form 👊🏼😎
.
.
.
.
A nice little TBT to last year’s Chicago marathon for

Throwing back this “Medal Monday” to my very first marathon back in 2015! ☺️ Back then, I couldn’t even believe I was capable of running 26.2 miles — now here I am, only 2 1/2 years later and less than 5 weeks away from attempting a 3:30! 😳 I’m so incredibly nervous but also SO excited for my trip to Eugene.. It’s gonna be here before I know it! 🙂 Now GIMME THAT BOSTON BIBBB!! 😉💙🦄💛
.
.
.
.

My nanospikes were absolute lifesavers today 🙌🏼 100% underestimated the snow, thinking the track would be cleared off enough to get some speed work in, anddd there were a solid 2 inches on the track... SO I took my speedwork to the road!! My own rendition of the @nikerunning workout at Reggie Lewis today, since clearly I’m still struggling to get there at 6:30...
200m, 400m, 800m, 1600m and back down @ mile pace, 5k, 10k, and MGP. 6 miles total for the day!
.
.
.
.

Never underestimate the importance of core strength! Plank variations, V-Ups, and Russian twists are a few of my faves 😎💪🏼
.
.
.
.

Nearly 6 months later, but my iTab FINALLY came for my @chimarathon medal! Nice little reminder of what I’m capable of, can’t wait to see what Eugene has in store for me in April!! 🙂
.
.
.
.

3 x 1600s on some tiiiired legs today, with 600m jog recovery between each 🏃🏻‍♀️💨 (7:08, 7:05, 7:01) — 7 miles total
Unfortunately my left Achilles was reeeally bothering me throughout the workout to the point where I almost had to cut it short, so tonight and tomorrow will be filled with a LOTTT of TLC for my poor lil’ gastrocs. Thank god for @teamtiux and @rollrecovery 🙌🏼❤️
.
.
.
.

How is it December already?! 😵Absolutely unbelievable. Similarly unbelievable, today was the second run this week with zero foot pain!!! Fingers crossed I’m finally through with that pesky tendonitis 🤞🏼4 easy miles today around an 8:45/mi pace, just focusing on form and getting that mileage back up! .
.
.
.

Rest day today, thank goddd 🙏🏻 There’s NO way I would’ve gotten myself running on this “feels like 24°” kind of day in Boston 😣 Luckily this quinoa stuffed acorn squash warmed me right up!! 🤤 .
.
.
.

Nice lil’ easy 5.5 miler keeping the HR low to veg out after my exams! Guess who survived her first semester of PT school!?! 👩🏻‍⚕️🤓
.
.
.
.

You never know what Mother Nature is gonna throw at you on race day — I try to keep that in mind on raw, rainy days like today when I would rather sleep in or wait for better conditions than do my long run 😴🌧 13 easy miles along the wet, windy Charles River today. It’s runs like this that give me the mental toughness to be a runner 💪🏼😎
.
.
.
.

I guess this view could be worse... Another frigid day meant another treadmill workout this AM! 4 miles @ 7.5mph and 1.0% incline, followed by some hip and glute strength!
.
.
.
.

2017 was an amazing year of growth and development. I can’t wait to see what 2018 brings! Here’s to a new year and new goals!! Time to do some work and get that Boston bib once and for all 👊🏼😏🦄
.
.
.
.

The first of two 20-milers done! ✅ Kept it at a 1:00+ min/mi slower than MGP. I went into this workout with the initial plan of trying out a glycogen-depletion run (TERRIBLE idea), so naturally I felt like completeee a$$ and caved and had a Gu at mile 14... 😣 But hopefully this tough workout will make my next 20-miler two weeks from now feel like a piece of cake!! 🍰🙂 I can’t believe the @eugenemarathon is only 5 weeks away... 😵
.
.
.
.

In weather like this, it’s alllll about getting in the mileage. Running on slippery, unshoveled sidewalks is a challenge in itself 😳❄️❄️❄️
.
.
.
.
This week’s

It’s been a busy past couple of days with PT school back in full swing, but thankfully I managed to fit in an easy 3 miles tonight after cadaver lab, and now onto some meal prep for the next few days! No excuses 👊🏼
.
.
.
.

Confession: I was SERIOUSLY doubting myself before this run. I’ve been loosely following one of the @heartbreakersrun marathon plans, and today‘s run was 14 miles — first 11 comfortable, then each of the last 3 faster than the previous. I’ve never really pushed myself during a long run before, I usually keep it at a nice relaxed pace, and I was 90% ready to just keep this whole run relaxed, too. But I gave it a go and I actually DID ITTT!!!
First 11 miles ~8:50-9:05/mi
Last 3 — 8:34, 8:06, 7:32 👊🏼
If you don’t try, you’ll never know what you’re capable of!! 💁🏻‍♀️
.
.
.
.

“Be confident in the work that you did to prepare for the race. Take a look back at your training logs to remind yourself that you’ve done everything possible to prepare. The race is the fun part, where you get to see the hard work pay off. Enjoy it.” - @des_linden :
:
:
I had SO. MUCH. DOUBT. in myself for today’s run. I already had one 20-miler under my belt for this training cycle, but today’s run called for 5 easy miles, followed by 15 at MGP. I’ve been struggling to judge whether or not I’m on target with my goal pace this cycle, so I was VERY nervous to see how today turned out. But somehow I managed to pull it off, and I couldn’t be happier!!! Can’t wait to see what I’m capable of on race day 🙂🙂🙂 and nowww....TAPER TIMEEEE!!!! 💃🏻🎉 Mamma miaaa time flies... .
.
.

Track Tuesday!! 🏃🏻‍♀️💨 1.5 mile w/u
2 x 3 mile repeats w/1 mile recovery jog in between
1.5 mile c/d
= 10 miles total for the day!
👊🏼
I had meant to keep the pace 10 seconds faster than goal MGP (~7:50/mi), buuut the pace just felt SO nice and smooth!!! I couldn’t help myself 🙈 .
.
.
.

FRIYAYYY!!! Easing back into speed work after a weekend of too much drinking followed by 3 days of the stomach bug with 4x800s on the treadmill today. Still not feeling 💯 so I took it a bit easier than I had wanted, but I was just getting so restless! 😛🏃🏻‍♀️
.
.
.
.

Yasso 800s with @heartbreakersrun kicked. my. BUTT. tonight. I was pretty bummed with my splits tbh, but I kind of had a feeling going into the workout that it wasn’t gonna turn out how I wanted 🤦🏻‍♀️ ...but that’s okay! I’m still 8 weeks out from the @eugenemarathon — plenty of time for improvement!
🏃🏻‍♀️Tonight’s workout: 🏃🏻‍♀️
*2.5 mile run-commute/warmup
*10x800s between 3:30-3:38 per rep (I was aiming for 3:28-3:30 😒) w/400m recovery jog between each
*2.5 mile run-commute home
= 12 miles total!
.
.
.
.

What a busy couple of days!!Awesome hike with @livemovethrive yesterday, followed by nachos (treat yo’self 🤤) then a 3.5 mile run, ending with 6x strides, and then ice skating! Then 4 easy miles today, focusing on keeping my HR lowww, and ending with 6x strides again! Today was the first day in a while that actually felt GOOD!!! 🙃🏃🏻‍♀️🤗
.
.
.
.

Halfway through training for the Eugene Marathon!!! 😳Today’s post calls for a throwback pic from training for my first marathon back in 2015, to summon some much needed strength and motivation 🏃🏻‍♀️ Between the gross weather today as well as a bit of pain still chillin’ in my Achilles, I was feeling a bit defeated 😕 I think I overdid it with speed work last week... 😒 So I’ll be taking it easy for the next week or so to try and get that nagging pain to go away 🤞🏼🤞🏼🤞🏼
.
.
.
.

When a neighbor sees you doing slow-mo B-skips (because I STILL don’t have them down pat at full speed 😒) and tells you that you look like the guy in Monty Python’s Ministry of Silly Walks sketch... 😂😂😂 He wasn’t wrong, let me tell you hahaha. 5 verrrry easy miles today, keeping the HR low, ending with 6x strides and some “silly walking” drills 😉 .
.
.
.

TEMPO THURSDAYYY! 4 miles @ MGP (okay, maybe a liiiittle faster than MGP...I got excited 😋) 6 miles total for the day! .
.
.
.

Taking it easy on the calf todayyy — intervals on the bike, followed by some hip strength to keep up that stability! Gonna try to get a few miles in tomorrow to see how everything’s feeling after a couple days rest, fingers crossed!!! 🤞🏼🤞🏼🤞🏼 .
.
.
.

Another kickass @heartbreakersrun workout tonight! 😎👊🏼 Did some downhill work at the Boston Common, followed by a nice 2.5 mile run commute home! Deffffinitely gonna be feeling that one tomorrow...
.
.
.
.

I don’t think I’ve ever felt so strong on a long run! 🙃 16 miles total for the day — the first 8 miles were nice and relaxed, then I pushed the pace for the last 8, finishing with a sub-8:00/mi for the last two miles!! This was just the confidence boost I needed for this training cycle 😄💃🏻
.
.
.
.

3 easy miles along with some leg and core strength today 💪🏼 I gotta say, I defffinitely take my city for granted all too often... how many people can say they run by the USS Constitution every day?! Feeling especially grateful on this lovely fall Tuesday 🙂
.
.
.

Welp — found my new favorite sports drink! 😍 Tried @maurten_official on my 13-miler today and I am IN LOVEEE. I’d been struggling with using Gu on my long runs recently — the further into the run I got, the more my body would struggle with absorbing everything, and my stomach would churn like crazy. But this stuff 👆🏼 AMAZING. No GI distress whatsoever, and I felt so properly fueled through my entire run. I only wish I’d discovered it sooner 😭
.
.
.
.

Literally sprinting to and from Charlestown between my AM and PM final exams to cheer on my idol @shalaneflanagan and to see @des_linden be the first American woman in 33 years to win the Boston Marathon?! SO. WORTH IT. Congrats to ALL the runners today — that weather was NO joke. You all are absolute inspirations!!! 💙💛
.
.
.
.

What a busy week back to classes so far 📚👩🏻‍⚕️ Thankfully fit in an easy 6-miler w/6x strides after cadaver lab this afternoon before nor’easter number 4 hits tonight... 😣 Fingers crosses that Boston doesn’t get slammeddd 🤞🏼
.
.
.
.

🎶 Dashing through the snow, for day 1 of spring training 🎶
4 miles through the snow up in NH today! Focused on keeping my HR nice and low, but finished up with 6x strides and then some core work once I got inside! Merry Christmas!!!❄️⛄️🎄 .
.
.

The wind was NOT my friend today — 5 mile tempo that felt sooo much harder than it should have 😓 7 miles total for the dayyy, happy weekend!!
.
.
.
.

First run of 2018! I wish I could say it was a good one, but unfortunately that is not case 🤦🏻‍♀️ My HR was SO elevated and about half a mile into my run, my stomach started churning. I managed to squeeze in 4 miles, but sure enough, within 30 minutes of getting back from my run, I had a fever and my stomach felt likeIt was trying to claw its way out of my body! Oh well, every run can’t be a great one. Hopefully it’s just a 24 hour bug!! 🤞🏼🤞🏼
.
.
.
.

Reflecting on the week ☀️☕️21 miles total this week, gradually starting to increase mileage again for the first time since the Chicago marathon! Let’s get that base work starteddd 🤘🏼😎 .
.
.
.

Best post workout snack, you ask? @pickybars, hands down. 🤤
.
.
.
.

I don’t know what was up with this weather today, but I am NOT complaining ☀️🌴 70 degree high in Boston today meant shorts and a tank top for my track workout!! 12 x 400s with 300m recovery jog between each, followed by hip strength 💪🏼
.
.
.
.

One of these days I’ll get to Heartbreaker practice again... 🤦🏻‍♀️ In the meantime, thank GOD I have a track a quarter of a mile from my apartment, and an awesome coach who sends out weekly emails with workoutsss @coachdanbos 🙌🏼
1 mile w/u
6x800s @ 7:13/mi avg
2 min jog recovery
8x200s @ 6:32/mi avg
200m jog recovery
2 mile c/d
.
.
.
.

Is it weird that I’m daydreaming of weather from February when it’s currently APRIL?! How was it 70° then and 40° now... 😒 6 very easy miles today, ending with 6x strides, A skips, and B skips (NOT pretty hahaha but they’re a work in progress!) HALFWAY THROUGH THE WEEK, GUYSSS!!! 🙌🏼
.
.
.
.

Took my new @asics Gel-Pursue 4s for a spin today and I am in loveeee 😍💕 These babies are gonna bring me to my sub-3:30 marathon, I can feel it 🤩 3 easy miles today followed by some hip strength! Now time to prep for the week 👊🏼🗓
.
.
.
.

Busy days like today make me SO happy that I meal prepped for the week 😅 Awesome workout tonight with an awesome group of people — 5 mile time trial: 2 @ MGP, 2 @ half marathon pace, and 1 @ 10k pace. Add in a warmup and a run-commute home and that added up to 10 miles for the evening! 🙂
.
.
.
.

Sunday Runday!!! An awesome, comfortable 11 miles today — my longest run since the Chicago Marathon back in October!! 😲 absolutely perfect weather for it, too :) now time to watch Tommy and the boys kick some butt 👊🏼 GO PATS!!! 🏈🎉
.
.
.
.

Track Tuesday! 🏃🏻‍♀️💨
Gradually adding speed back into my workouts, and I couldn’t be more excited about it 🤗 8x400s today! Tried staying around a 7:05/mi pace, but I was feeling great and got a little too excited... (6:46, 7:00, 7:08, 7:03, 6:44, 7:00, 6:57, 6:32) DEFFFinitely need to work on pacing myself a bit 🤦🏻‍♀️
.
.
.
.

First 200+ mile month ever!!! Before this, my highest monthly mileage ever was 167 during my Chicago training last Fall. I never thought I would be someone who could log that many miles — especially while trying to balance training with full time grad school — so seeing these numbers made me ECSTATIC!! 😁 Here’s to hoping that all of those miles in the bank pay off on race day in t-minus 4 weeks!!! 🤞🏼🏃🏻‍♀️💨
.
.
.
.

Pretty lucky that the week I’m having leg pain is the week we’re covering lower leg/ankle in PT school 😋🍀 I’ve gotten a ton of great advice over the past couple of days, from both the running pros side of things (shout-out to @coachdanbos and your Live session — you rock 🙌🏼) and from the anatomy pros side AKA my professors, both of whom I can’t thank enoughhh — I had been SO stressed out about it 😣 Did a VERY easy 8 mile run-commute home from cadaver lab this evening with ZERO posterior tib pain!! Let’s hope the worst is over! 🤞🏼 140 miles for the month, a little less than I’d been aiming for, but sometimes you gotta make adjustments 💁🏻‍♀️ Onto March we go!!! 🏃🏻‍♀️💨
.
.
.
.

Boston, you were stunning this morning 😍 6 verrrry easy miles, due to both my speed work yesterday AND the insane amount of black ice ice this morning. Still feeling a bit of piriformis pain, so tonight will be filllled with foam rolling!
.
.
.
.
Visiting the parents = visiting some of my old favorite running routes 🙂 4 easy miles today to work off yesterday’s feast — and no foot pain today!!! 🤗👟

What is this nor’easter that everyone’s talking about?? 😉35-50mph winds made me feel like I was doing parachute drills the entire 6 miles 🤦🏻‍♀️ Hoping this weather clears for my long run on Sunday! Happy weekend, everybody!! 🙂
.
.
.
.

Sunday Runday!!! 10 miles in the books today — first double digit run since the Chicago Marathon!! Aside from the insane wind gusts, I’m so happy with how it went! Feels great getting my mileage back up again 🙂
.
.
.
.
.

Who has two thumbs and has no idea what her pace was on her run today?! THIS GIRLLLL. Ran without my Garmin today for the first time in AGES. Honestly, it’s been months since I’ve gone without it. But I ran somewhere around 4-5 easy miles and couldn’t have felt more relaxed!!! Definitely need to incorporate more technology-free runs into my training!
.
.
.
.

2 easy miles today to get this week’s mileage up to 40 (come onnn, I couldn’t leave it at 38...) followed by some core work aaand this delicious salad 🤤 .
.
.
.

8 easy miles to de-stress between today’s practical exam and written final! Running is just the best medicine 🙂💊❤️ and nowww... SPRING BREAK!!! Time for some much needed R&R 😴
.
.
.
.

PSA: Vacay does NOT equal rest day 😉🏃🏻‍♀️💪🏼 Back in the DMV area to visit some college friends and see my sister’s new house! Turns out her new digs has a workout room in it, so obvvvv I went to town 😏
5 mile run around her neighborhood and then some core and hip strength!
.
.
.
.

That feeling when your shoelace gets caught on a nail on the wooden dock and you go down like a ton of bricks and have to cut your run short... 🤦🏻‍♀️ Gonna be feeling that one tomorrowww.
.
.
.
.

Decided to use this blizzard as an excuse to get in some strength work rather than attempting to make it to the gym — I think my legs could use an extra day off after some weird pains during my long run on Sunday, anyway. Listen to your body!! It knows what it needs!!! 🙂💪🏼
.
.
.
.

Today’s run felt SO good!!! Easy 10k, keeping it at a nice comfortable pace (~8:40/mi) for the first 5 miles, then kicked it up to 7:30 for the last 1.2! Now excuse me while I veg out in my new @loveyourmelon beanie and @shalaneflanagan T-shirt 😛
.
.
.
.

10 more windy miles in the bank today! After my posterior tib pain last week, I’m taking a slight step back from my “track tuesdays” and “tempo thursdays” and just focusing on form and getting my mileage back up there. Still feeling good!! 🤞🏼🙂
.
.
.
.

Gliding though the week like....
🌟🚀😉
4 easy miles today along with a killer core workout. I’ve been focusing a lot on arm swing recently, trying to make sure my shoulders stay nice and relaxed, and today felt awesomeee!💪🏼
.
.
.
.

As training winds down, I find myself getting more and more antsy for this weekend 😬 Now more than ever I just need to remind myself to trust the process. In the meantime, this weather has definitely been helping me relax the past couple of days 😍☀️
.
.
.
.

Throwing it back on this unbelievably frigid Boston day to a beautifully warm afternoon in Annapolis last May... one can daydream 🤔💭 5 miles on the treadmill this morning, fueled by an amazing @heartbreakersrun treadmill workout vid 😍👊🏼
.
.
.
